title: UI polish: remove Caffeine credit & heart, add logo badge, refine typography colors, and subtle animations

requirements.summary: Remove any Caffeine build credit text and caffeine.ai referral link from the footer while keeping other footer content unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer no longer renders any text that mentions “Built with”, “using caffeine.ai”, “caffeine.ai”, or similar Caffeine build credit wording.
No caffeine.ai referral link is present anywhere in the rendered UI.
All other footer content (copyright line, year, business name) remains visible and unchanged.

file_operations.description: Update the footer to remove the entire “Built with … using caffeine.ai” line and remove the outbound caffeine.ai link, preserving the existing copyright line exactly as-is.

requirements.summary: Remove all heart emoji/symbol usage (including decorative heart icons) across the production UI while keeping user-facing text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: No heart emoji (e.g., ❤️) is rendered anywhere in the UI.
No heart icon/symbol is rendered inline as a decorative replacement for emoji (e.g., the footer line currently using a Heart icon is removed or updated to not include a heart).
No new non-English user-facing strings are introduced as part of this change.

file_operations.description: Remove the Heart icon usage from the UI (including the About section decorative icon and any footer usage), update imports accordingly, and ensure any replacement decorative element is non-heart (or omitted) without changing existing user-facing text content.

requirements.summary: Present the HND logo with a light-green background badge/container in both header and hero while keeping the logo image intact and accessible.
acceptanceCriteria: The HND logo in the header and hero is displayed on top of a clearly visible light-green background shape (badge/container).
The light-green background does not create visible jagged edges/boxes around the logo image itself (logo image should still look clean on the dark theme).
Logo remains accessible with appropriate alt text unchanged (e.g., “HND Restaurant logo”).

file_operations.description: Wrap the header logo <SafeImage> in a rounded light-green badge/container (with padding) so the transparent logo sits cleanly on the badge; keep existing alt text unchanged.
Wrap the hero logo <SafeImage> in a larger rounded light-green badge/container (with padding) to match the header treatment; keep existing alt text unchanged and preserve the logo image source.

requirements.summary: Refine site-wide text colors away from pure white while preserving readability on dark theme, and add subtle UI animations without changing content/sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary text (foreground) is changed from pure/near-pure white to a slightly softer off-white, while maintaining strong contrast on the dark background.
Muted text remains visibly readable (not too dim) and maintains hierarchy vs. headings/body text.
Subtle animations are present (e.g., gentle entrance/fade/slide for sections or cards, and/or refined hover/focus transitions) without adding new sections or changing existing content text.
No changes are made to menu item names/prices text content; animations must not interfere with navigation/section swapping behavior.

file_operations.description: Adjust the theme tokens for --foreground and --muted-foreground (and any related text tokens as needed) to use a softer off-white for primary text and a readable muted tone, maintaining strong contrast on the dark background.

Extend Tailwind animation/keyframes to support subtle entrance and micro-interaction animations (e.g., gentle fade/slide), using existing project tooling only (no new third-party animation libraries).

Apply a subtle entrance animation to sections when they mount (works naturally with reveal-based rendering), including motion-reduction handling so animations are non-intrusive and do not affect layout/scroll behavior.

Refine hover/focus micro-interactions (e.g., smoother transitions, subtle lift/shadow) without changing any menu item names/prices/content text, and ensure animations do not interfere with clicking or dialog behavior.
Add subtle container/card entrance or transition styling for menu category presentation (non-content), ensuring the UI remains readable and navigation/section swapping behavior is unaffected.
